Name: washington_dc_2005_anc90ply
LayerDisplayName: Advisory Neighborhood Commission Boundary, Washington, DC 2002
Abstract:
This dataset represents the boundaries of Advisory Neighborhood Commission in Washington, DC 2002 This dataset contains polygons representing ANC boundaries in 1990, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. These political jurisdictions were identified from public records, including published maps and written legal descriptions and heads-up digitized from the snap base.
All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.

    <descript>
      <abstract>This dataset represents the boundaries of Advisory Neighborhood Commission in Washington, DC 2002 This dataset contains polygons representing ANC boundaries in 1990, created as part of the DC Geographic Information System (DC GIS) for the D.C. Office of the Chief Technology Officer (OCTO) and participating D.C. government agencies. These political jurisdictions were identified from public records, including published maps and written legal descriptions and heads-up digitized from the snap base.
All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.
</abstract>

            <title>1992 D.C. Board of Elections and Ethics ANC boundaries map</title>
            <geoform>map</geoform>
            <othercit>Map contains ANC SMDs, ANCs, wards, and voting precincts based on 1992 redistricting from 1990 census figures. Features may be named after the census year rather than the redistricting year. Wards and census tracts align fairly closely, with few census tracts being split by wards.</othercit>

      <procstep>
        <procdesc>Dataset copied from the CD obtained from Washington, DC 2005

1992 political map was heads-up digitized from the 1995 orthophotographs and a shapefile was created. A base ArcInfo coverage of correct linework (snapbase.e00) for all DC data was developed after the final delivery of the planimetric street centerlines. The political datasets were selected using the above shapefile from the snapbase coverage, creating coincident geography with the other DC GIS datasets. The resulting planimetric features were built as lines and converted to polygons. When imported into the DC GIS geodatabase, the coverages shift 0.01mm since the geodatabase supports only 11 digits of precision, not double precision (16 digits). The three political jurisdictions were created together since they share partial topology and nest partially within each other. Generally, a street centerline is used as a boundary. Line coverages, containing the polygons bounding attributes, accompany all polygons and are made available for editing and updating purposes.

Attribute data was provided by public record. Planimetrics were created at a scale of 1:1,000. This means that a well defined feature falls within two feet of true position.

All DC GIS data is stored and exported in Maryland State Plane coordinates NAD 83 meters.</procdesc>
        <procdate>20010806</procdate>
